sentences.english: It is so thin that you secretly smile at it and I feel ashamed.
sentences.chinese: 這一層薄紗，薄得使你暗暗地竊笑，我感到害羞。

sentences.english: A lady standing close to her tittered.
sentences.chinese: 她近邊一個女人竊笑起來。

sentences.english: And I have seen the eternal Footman hold my coat, and snicker.
sentences.chinese: 我曾眼見永恆的守門人接過我的大衣，然後竊笑。

sentences.english: That remark might arouse snickers from people around the league.
sentences.chinese: 這番話難保不會招致聯盟其他成員的竊笑。

sentences.english: I didn't recognize the snicker though.
Several of the boys tittered again.
Brockway watched me out of the corner of his eye, snickering noiselessly .
sentences.chinese: 布羅克韋斜着眼睛看我，無聲地竊笑着。

sentences.english: As soon as someone says "don't laugh, " you're immediate inclination is to either snicker or guffaw.
sentences.chinese: 只要有人說“不準笑”，你會馬上開始偷笑或竊笑。

sentences.english: In a dark place, someone who was laughing in secret is Plagiarist.
sentences.chinese: 在陰暗處，有人在竊笑著，他是剽竊者。

sentences.english: At school, your classmates start to snicker.
sentences.chinese: 到了學校，同學們開始竊笑。

sentences.english: The students snickered at the young man's question.
sentences.chinese: 其他學生紛紛竊笑那位年輕人的問題。

sentences.english: He snickered that he would go.
The shuffle and snicker become the comedians trademark.
sentences.chinese: 攪和與竊笑成爲那個戲劇演員的標誌。
人羣中發出了一陣竊笑。

definition: scene which recalls past memories (idiom)/evocative of the past/reminiscent/to arouse deep feelings
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to be at a loss for words/speechless
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
